spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Blackheart's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma. It can innately cast the following spells (spell save {@dc 15}), requiring no material components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Blackheart is a 14th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}, +7 to hit with spell attacks). He regains his expended spell slots when it finishes a short or long rest. It knows the following warlock spells:

trait.name: Whispering Aura
entries: At the start of each of Blackheart's turns, each creature of its choice within 5 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage, provided that Blackheart isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

reaction.name: Shape Up, Ye Dog (2/Day)
entries: Whenever a friendly creature within 30 feet of Blackheart that can hear it misses with an attack, Blackheart can yell perilous threats to allow that creature to reroll the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The captain makes two attacks: one with his flintlock pistol and one with its scimitar.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Flintlock Pistol (Reload 1)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 15/60 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

"Angus Skyme came to the Spanish Main in the brig of HMSÂ Prudence. He escaped the gallows and gathered the roughest crew in the Caribbean. Blackheart shows no quarter to his victims or crew, and he has killed many of both for his amusement and profit. He still bears the scar from the duel he fought with Jack Hawkins over Lady Arcadia de Sol, and he still nurses the grudge that goes with it."

Known to use torture and other unspeakable acts to acquire gold, Blackheart is considered by many to be no better than the Cursed. Still, he is pirate through and through, only too willing to inflict a little bloodshed to guarantee respect.
Some say that Blackheart has already sold his soul to the demons of the sea. Others say that he fights them like he has fought everyone else: to his death or theirs.

Now that Blackheart has carved out an empire based on fear and terror, he can concentrate on his biggest goal: destroying the other pirates of the Spanish Main, starting with Jack Hawkins and his accursed monkey.
